Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Stenting and Aggressive Medical Management for Intracranial Stenosis

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence

Participants.evidence: patients with ICAD who suffered a hemorrhagic or ischemic stroke or a cerebral infarct with temporary signs (CITS) within 30 days of attempted angioplasty and stenting

Intervention.evidence: angioplasty and stenting for intracranial atherosclerotic disease (ICAD)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the occurrence of peri-procedural stroke within 30 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 21 patients suffered an ischemic stroke (n=19) or CITS (n=2) within 30 days of angioplasty and stenting.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Most ischemic strokes (n=15) were in the perforator territory, with many occurring after successful angioplasty and stenting of the basilar artery (n=8).

Harms.evidence: Six patients experienced subarachnoid hemorrhage, and seven had delayed intraparenchymal hemorrhage.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under [Trial Registration Number]
